alert.note: Alert for Dubuque; Jackson (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 4:22AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Jo Daviess, northwestern Carroll, Jackson, southeastern Dubuque and Clinton Counties through 500 AM CDT... At 422 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from East Dubuque to Grand Mound. Movement was northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Galena, East Dubuque and Menominee around 425 AM CDT. Council Hill around 435 AM CDT. Charlotte around 440 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Preston, Spragueville, Miles, Andover, Savanna and Sabula. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM CDT for northwestern Illinois...and east central Iowa.
